content: magic_ring goose designed by crochetbyghosts terms of use this pattern is for personal use only so please do not distribute it you may sell the finished object if you credit me for the pattern tag me @crochetbyghosts on instagram so i can see what you make if you have any questions feel free to contact me on instagram happy crocheting materials ● super bulky 6 weight yarn i use bernat blanket yarn in vintage white and school bus yellow ● medium / worsted 4 weight yarn in dark brown for nostrils ● 6 mm size j crochet hook ● 10 mm safety eyes ● scissors yarn needle stuffing stitch marker approximate dimensions the finished object measures 37 cm from beak to foot and 21 cm from wing to wing @crochetbyghosts 2 abbreviations us terminology ● chain - chain ● single_crochet - single_crochet ● st - stitch ● slip_stitch - slip_stitch ● increase - increase by working two single crochets in the same stitch ● decrease - decrease by single crocheting two stitches together i recommend using invisible decrease ● bobble - 3 double_crochet bobble stitch ○ in a normal bobble stitch you start four double crochets into the same stitch instead of this start three only ● flo - insert hook into the front loop of stitch only ● r # - current round number ● single_crochet 1 increase # times - repeat instructions in parenthesis as many times as indicated ● # at the end of each line of instruction indicates the total number of stitches you should have by the end of that round @crochetbyghosts 3 body begin with yellow yarn r1 single_crochet 6 in magic_ring 6 r2-4 single_crochet in each stitch around 6 change color to white yarn r5 in flo increase in each stitch around 12 slip_stitch into the first white stitch and continue in the round r6 single_crochet in each stitch around 12 r7 single_crochet 1 increase 3 times single_crochet 3 increase 3 times single_crochet 2 18 r8 single_crochet in each stitch around 18 r9 single_crochet 1 decrease single_crochet 1 decrease single_crochet 3 decrease single_crochet 1 decrease single_crochet 4 14 r10 single_crochet in each stitch around 14 the position of the current stitch on your hook will be near the top left of the face fasten safety eyes in the second white row approximately 4 stitches apart sew on nostrils as pictured r11 single_crochet 2 single_crochet 1 decrease 4 times 10 at this point stuff the head @crochetbyghosts 4 r12 single_crochet 1 decrease 3 times single_crochet 1 7 r13-14 single_crochet in each stitch around 7 r15 single_crochet 1 increase 3 times single_crochet 1 10 r16 single_crochet 1 increase 5 times 15 r17 single_crochet 2 increase 5 times 20 r18 single_crochet 3 increase 5 times 25 r19 single_crochet in each stitch around 25 r20 single_crochet 4 increase 5 times 30 r21-23 single_crochet in each stitch around 30 r24 single_crochet 4 decrease 5 times 25 r25 single_crochet in each stitch around 25 r26 single_crochet 3 decrease 5
